SEARCH
Package game.actors.nonplayercharacters.summonables

Interface Summonable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Ally, Invader
public interface Summonable
A Summonable interface represents an actor that can be summoned from another realm. It gives promises to every actor that can be summoned from another realm such that their classes implementing this interface should have also implemented these methods listed below. This interface is crucial when summoning an actor from another realm to calculate the summon chance, the get the summon location and to place itself to the specific location in a game map via the implementation of the specific methods. Created by:
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Che'er Min Yi, Chong Ming Sheng, Lam Xin Yuan

  • Method Details

    • getSummonChance

      int getSummonChance()
      Getter that get the summon chance of the summonable actor.
      Returns:
      int that representing summon chance

    • summoned

      void summoned(GameMap map, Location location)
      Adds the summonable actor to the game map when summoned.
      Parameters:
      map - the GameMap to add the actor to
      location - The location to summon the actor

    • getSummonSpot

      Location getSummonSpot(Location summonGroundLocation)
      Returns the location where the summonable actor can be summoned.
      Parameters:
      summonGroundLocation - the location of the summon ground
      Returns:
      the location where the actor can be summoned, null when there is no available location that Ally can be summoned
